sub_title: Coordinating Policy Officer Youth & Education at Ministry of Foreign Affairs
summary:
I am a professional schooled in Architecture, Urbanism & Building sciences, specialized in Urban Area Development with a strong passion for Education, Entrepreneurship, Youth and Sustainability. I combine creativity and social empathy with analytical skills and organizing capabilities, which I incorporate in innovative strategies, policies & program's. Colleagues characterize me as a flexible, dynamic, resourceful, helpful and motivating social person that combines his passions with pragmatic realism and commitment.  

I am a true believer of partnerships. Imagine if from today we could create an entrepreneurial generation with a critical mindset!? 

We can create high level platforms that listen to the (local)challenges of (young) people, address them to the responsible parties & jointly draft tangible solutions. TOGETHER is the key word! Such collabs could subsequently decrease unnecessary obstacles & positively contribute to a decent future for all with respect to our planet. 

The last 8 years I have been analyzing entrepreneurial-ecosystems & initiating support structures in various African, European and Middle East cities through our Dutch Embassies with the support of multinational companies, universities & organizations & of course my team (14).  

In addition to that I have been working on the development of a ''Meaningful Youth Participation Toolkit'' for our Ministry to ensure the voices of youth are heard and incorporated in our foreign policies & program's. 

Currently I am working on the development of a global TVET & Higher Education program. I firmly believe that education is THE foundation for a prosperous and equitable society. 

My aim is to gain additional understanding of strategic details of: educational & entrepreneurial ecosystems, system changes, youth, innovation & policies, private sector development & engagement, diplomacy, urban planning, climate resilience and adaptation in order to plan for the future.

My objective is to combine practice with research & apply knowledge into policies & program's that have a long term sustainable impact & strengthen the relations between the various actors with a positive output for people & planet. We have work to do! Join me!

education.field_of_study: Real Estate & Housing, Urban Area Development

organizations.name: Hellenic Student Society of the Netherlands

projects.title: #COCREATEMYCITY  Johannesburg
projects.description: #COCREATEMYCITY was a 1 month project in which multidisciplinary groups of MSc students from NL and SA, work together to produce tangible solutions for urban challenges designated by the city of Johannesburg. For 10 days the student teams worked together in Joburg and were guided by leading professionals from different sectors. The teams presented this proposed solutions to the Prime Minister of the NL, the CEO of TOMTOM Africa, the VC and Principal of WITS university, the deputy Mayor of City of Joburg and the CEO of IBM Africa. Furthermore they were able to try-out their solutions and win a visit to the Netherlands.

projects.title: Maritime and Offshore activities in the coast of India
projects.description:
With a group of six multidisciplinary graduate students we researched, commissioned by the EVD for the Holland Marine Equipment (HME), the maritime and offshore activities mainly on the East coast of India for two months on location. After having prepared our field visit for 4 months in the Netherlands.

In addition we looked at the possibilities for collaboration between the Delft University of Technology (TUDelft) and the Indian Maritime University (IMU). We therefore visited most of the campuses of the university in India together with some official visits to the Indian Institute of Technology (IIT).

profile_positions.description:
As part of the ''Technical & Vocational Training (TVET)'' and ''Higher Education (HE)'' team (BHO) in the department of Social Development of our ministry, I am responsible for the design and creation of the ''new'' capacity development programme on both TVET & HE. The programme is an overarching MFA programme connecting & complementing the objectives of our thematic departments for the benefit of the youth we work for. 

Our aim with this programme is to advance, equip and inspire people as well as institutions in our focus regions to transform their education systems and better anticipate their current & future challenges. Resilience & (job) prospects for the youth are our ultimate goals, which we can only achieve with a context conscious approach per country and together with the whole education ecosystem on board.
profile_positions.title: Policy Coordinator Youth & Education

profile_positions.description:
As the team leader of the Youth Employment & Entrepreneurship Team I headed a highly motivated team that was assisting our embassies in implementing programmes for the youth.  As the program manager of Orange Corners Global, under the Private Sector Development program of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, I was responsible together with my team to: 

1) Conduct a feasibility study and understand the local context & dynamics.

2) Make a mapping of the local stakeholders. 

3) Draft a recommendations report and a plan of engagement for our colleagues at our Embassy.

4) Initiate Government to Government & Knowledge to Knowledge programs that will strengthen the local ecosystem and that have an added value to the ecosystem. 

5) Furthermore, support our embassies in setting up and rolling out a customized, to the local context, Orange Corners program in the country. 

This programma which is  initiative by the Kingdom of the Netherlands aims to support the local entrepreneurial ecosystem by providing access to networks, customized knowledge tools, skills & other relevant instruments. It is a joint effort of multinational corporations, local & dutch knowledge institutes and local & international organisations. 

Fostering the enabling environment for Entrepreneurs is a key factor for economic growth & innovation. For this reason, the Dutch Government supports Start-ups & Skills 4 Jobs in and outside the Netherlands.

I have invented this programme in South Africa in 2015 and the programme is now active in 13 countries through our embassies and has OC hubs in 17 cities and it is still growing! My team has grown from 1 intern in 2015 to 13 full time employees and 4 interns and 2 marketing & communication colleagues. The Orange Corners Innovation Fund, was initiated in 2019 as a respons to the missing funding opportunities for young (aspiring) entrepreneurs.
profile_positions.title: Program Manager Orange Corners Global

profile_positions.description: As a member of the Youth Education and Work team under the Ambassador at -Large Tijmen Rooseboom, I was responsible for the design of the ''Meaningful Youth Participation Toolkit''.  The toolkit supports our colleagues at our embassies and our ministerial departments to incorporate the voice, ideas and thoughts of the youth we are supporting and working with in the various countries. In addition it is a inspiration manual for other individuals and organizations in order to foster meaningful participation of youth in decisions, planning, programming and work in general.
profile_positions.title: Senior Policy Officer Youth, Education & Work

profile_positions.description: Together with the team of the special Ambassador for Youth Education and Work we are working towards putting youth in the design table of our Foreign Policies & Development Cooperation.
profile_positions.title: Senior Policy Officer Youth, Education & Work

profile_positions.description: Designing interiors and corporate identity for retail shops and restaurants. Furthermore supervising the construction of the proposed designs.
profile_positions.title: Owner

profile_positions.description: My tasks at the TU Delft | Global Initiative is to map, evaluate, expand and set up a Sub-Saharan Africa Excellence Network. The aim of this network is to foster academic collaboration in research, related to Global Challenges (UN-SDG's) that produce tangible solutions. In addition to act as a TU Delft ambassador in the various African countries that are going to be visited and organize interactive discussions on ''Local Challenges'' that require ''Global'' partnerships. Furthermore to make an inventory of the Tech Hubs related to universities.
profile_positions.title: Researcher - Liaison Sub Saharan Africa

company.name: Embassy of the Kingdom of the Netherlands to South Africa

profile_positions.company: Embassy of the Kingdom of the Netherlands to South Africa
profile_positions.description:
During my work at the NL embassy in SA I was responsible for the setup of a support structure for entrepreneurs that would combined forefront trainings, excellent facilities and connects various stakeholders. The aim was to support current and prospect entrepreneurs from both the NL and SA. This has resulted to the Orange Corners which were successfully launched in September 2016 after a thorough research of the Startup Ecosystem of South Africa. In this project the embassy partners with various stakeholders from the public & private sector as well as local and Dutch knowledge institutes.

Apart from this responsibility, in the second half of 2015 we prepared the official visit of Prime Minister Rutte in November together with high representatives of the Dutch government & a large trade delegation. For this reason  '​'House of the Future'' (HoF) a week long event, was organized www.houseofthefutute.co.za 

My role, as one of the 5 program managers, was to ensure that Entrepreneurship was an integral theme of HoF. For this purpose various events & activities were organized prior, during & after the visit. The biggest project was #COCREATEMYCITY were 5 students teams from NL & SA solve challenges of Johannesburg provided by the mayor of the city. This is a concept I invented taking into account the nature of the visit, the embassy activities and the local context of the city.  Furthremore TEDx Johannesburg was co-organized with the curators, as well as interactive discussions #StartSAup with Ministers, CEOS & prominent figures from the Entrepreneurship space.
profile_positions.title: Senior Policy Officer Youth & Entrepreneurship

company.name: Embassy of the Kingdom of the Netherlands to Ghana, Ivory Coast, Liberia, Sierra Leone and Togo

profile_positions.company: Embassy of the Kingdom of the Netherlands to Ghana, Ivory Coast, Liberia, Sierra Leone and Togo
profile_positions.description: In the framework of the new public diplomacy style I was asked to conduct a research on the Startup Ecosystem of Ghana and identify possibilities for the Netherlands Embassy to support & engage with young entrepreneurs in the region. The field work included meetings with key figures of the Ecosystem and relevant stakeholders. The end result was a recommendations report.
profile_positions.title: Consultant in Entrepreneuship

company.name: Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Embassy of the Kingdom of The Netherlands in Greece

profile_positions.description: Worked at the Embassy of the Kingdom of The Netherlands in Greece to help setup Orange Grove. A flexible workspace for young entrepreneurs that aims to make a change in the current brain-drain Greece is facing. My role was to ensure that the decisions taken, during the formation of the initiative, will not lose scope from the needs and demands of the actual target group, which is: Greek and Dutch students & graduates. Furthermore it was to create content for the Social Media channels and promote the initiative throughout them and to make sure that together with the Architect the space has an attractive appearance.  Currently, my role from the Netherlands is to actively promote it with presentations and networking events.
profile_positions.title: Project Trainee for the Orange Grove Athens

profile_positions.description:
During my work at the International Marketing Department I have conducted researches concerning the trends of the international student society of the University. I organized projects for the department of the university and worked on implementation of (international) marketing strategies. Furthermore I had to maintain and update the online profiles of the TUDelft is websites such as: educations.com , masterstudies.edu, studyportals.com etc.

In addition part of my role was to organizing presentations for prospect students and alumni network events abroad.
profile_positions.title: Marketing assistant at the International Marketing Department

profile_positions.description: With the Social Media team we were responsible to create content for the Social Media channels of the University and be the reporters on the events that took place at the University. Some of our projects were the Student Housing in Delft, Dare to ask, and Secret Facilities of the University.  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5zXJkm4vwyo
profile_positions.title: Social Media Student team

profile_positions.company: Stichting International Research Projects Delft (IRP Delft)
profile_positions.description: The International Research Projects Delft (IRPdelft) foundation is a group consisting of selected multidisciplinary students from different education backgrounds of the Delft University of Technology (TU Delft). IRPdelft provides innovative technological and strategic solutions on an academic level which will give your company the means to investigate business opportunities in countries with emerging economies and markets.
profile_positions.title: Commissioner External Affairs at International Research Projects Delft
